text: Hi, is it possible to use HubSpot CMS in a headless mode? E.g. I want our business department to be able to mange the content in HubSpot and then pull this content, maybe via an api to another self built website?
We do have APIs for creating, modifying, and controlling publishing of site pages. That said we do not consider HubSpot a headless CMS. It is a SaaS CMS.
Do you need a certain account level to use this API?
And is this API just about controlling the publishing or can content also be pulled?

All of the CMS APIs are what Iâ€™m referring to You can find them listed in the left sidebar of the developer documentation <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview>

Each API doc will state whether it requires an API key or OAuth.

Generally speaking API wise if you have the capability to do something in the app, - and there is an API for doing that thing - then the API is available at your tier.

For a more exact answer for specific APIs see <https://developers.HubSpot.com/apisbytier>
